stream_context.summary: Kaze live–codes visual polish and bug-fixes for the oil-themed “Oily Body Mine” factory level, importing Biobak’s new assets, adding sparkles, lighting, elevator camera logic and refining the psychedelic ‘fuzzy’ rewind effect. Numerous engine quirks (GlideN render bug, pointer math, colour-rim mismatch) are diagnosed and patched in real time while outlining the remaining task list.

development_findings.summary: Level remake: Biobak rebuilt the entire Oily Body Mine set; Kaze finished importing all areas (office, underground, factory) and added dynamic lights from windows and ceiling.
Several assets still pending: Bowser’s chair animation and additional props Biobak plans to deliver.
Memory is tight; Kaze rejected extra decorative scales because the course “is very low on memory.”
development_findings.quote: I don't think I can add them to the course because this course is very low on memory.

development_findings.summary: Upgraded to Blender 4.x but Kaze dislikes changes (vertex-colour picker, material pipeline) and had to devise new colour-picking workflow for vertex-rim fix.
development_findings.quote: Oh, we're on the new Blender 4 and I am not a fan of it. They messed up some important things.

development_findings.summary: Persistent GlideN render bug prevents per-ball lighting on cable lights; acknowledged as ‘unfixable’ on current plugin.
development_findings.quote: This is unfortunately going to be bugged forever. This is a Glideon bug. Nothing we can do.

development_findings.summary: Underground floor collision fails with oil fuzzies; suspected broken DMA pointers. Issue left open.
development_findings.quote: It looks like some of the ROM pointers break, which breaks the music and the animations.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming crystals: #14 will be a Space Casino, #15 a cardboard/paper-craft level.
Sparkle path system coded; initial bug (objects teleporting) traced to missing sqrt; fixed and parameterised size & speed.
development_findings.quote: I forgot the SQR, okay now it works.

development_findings.summary: ‘Touch fuzzy, get dizzy’ effect refined: rim colour mismatch fixed by pulling exact vertex RGBs and updating prim colour; now resets correctly.
Safe-respawn logic updated so Mario’s ‘safe position’ isn’t stored while hanging from a ledge, preventing soft-lock.
Special fixed camera added inside elevator; collision & camera offset tweaked 40 units inward to avoid wall clipping.
Background skyline seen through tower window added with water layer; vertex colours adjusted for opacity.
To-do list (excerpt): add elevator music, factory platform light effects, sparkle overlap with life-bar, janitor NPC with Biobak text, finish Bowser chair anims, fix underground floor bug.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses strong dislike for Super Mario Sunshine cut-scenes, revealing design philosophy valuing uninterrupted control.
context_findings.quote: Every time the game takes control away from me, it just feels like a small kick to my balls.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated by German bureaucracy; moved away nearly three years ago and still deals with paperwork.
context_findings.quote: Even back then they were just like… I just turn into a sad cat when I have to deal with German bureaucracy.

context_findings.summary: Lives in Canada (evidenced by kebab discussion) and streams while handling time-zone & exhaustion from pre-stream work.
Shows humorous, laid-back persona—frequent tangents, embraces community memes, enjoys ‘trashy’ shows like The Boys.
Admits fatigue halfway through stream but pushes to complete task list, illustrating work ethic and scope crunch.
context_findings.quote: It's only 3:30 but I'm feeling so exhausted already…

biobak.summary: Rebuilt Oily Body Mine level geometry and is creating additional assets (fans, scales, janitor text).
biobak.quote: I was working on this level here that Biobak remade.

biobak.summary: Optimised memory by removing unused textures, slightly improving N64 performance.
biobak.quote: The performance is basically not moved at all. If anything, it's slightly better because Biobak removed a lot of textures.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback in chat on sparkle type (star vs electric) and on correct fan models.

zeina.summary: Present in chat; minimal development input this stream. Mentioned doing laundry; had to leave mid-stream.

key_stories.title: Hunting the Sparkle Path Bug
key_stories.summary: While implementing moving sparkles along overhead cables, the effects teleported to the wrong coordinates. Kaze cloned ‘debug Marios’ to visualise positions, discovered a math error (missing square-root), and instantly corrected it.
key_stories.challenge: Sparkles spawned at wrong waypoints due to pointer math.
key_stories.process: Added debug models, isolated value, realised distance calc lacked sqrt.
key_stories.outcome: Sparkles now move smoothly; size and speed parameters adjusted.
key_stories.key_quote: I forgot the SQR, okay now it works.

key_stories.title: Fixing the Fuzzy Rim Colour
key_stories.summary: Touching an oil fuzzy triggers a psychedelic rewind effect but left an ugly orange rim on distant geometry. Kaze needed exact vertex colours but Blender 4 changed the picker. After experimenting, he found a workaround and synchronised prim colours, eliminating the rim.
key_stories.challenge: Mismatched rim colour broke immersion during fuzzy effect.
key_stories.process: Searched Blender UI for vertex RGBs, tested shader code, exported level.
key_stories.outcome: Rim now matches environment; effect looks seamless.
key_stories.key_quote: There we go! Then orange… How is this possible?—(after fix) There we go!
